website_summaries.verdict: An affordable, straightforward, no-frills text and CD set best suited to older students.
pros: Book flows logically, and concepts are explained concisely
Included CD corresponds with lessons and helps with pronunciation challenges
cons: Contains a handful of spelling errors
May move too fast for some

customer_reviews.title: Very good method to learn German!
customer_reviews.text: This book is very good at explaining grammar rules and how to structure proper sentences. The audio CD is very helpful to know if you're pronouncing words properly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not helpful and only a small amount of vocabulary
customer_reviews.text: I needed to brush up on my German after 25 years not using it. This book explains a lot of rules but gives you such a small amount of vocabulary and not even in an easy to remember format that it is almost useless. The first 2 chapters you basically just learn 'What is your name?" and "How are you?'". Very disappointed and going to order a different book right now. :(
customer_reviews.author: Mer Ohrms

customer_reviews.title: Great resource
customer_reviews.text: This book is an amazing resource for anyone that is willing to put the time into learning the German language. It not only gives you words to learn but it also teaches you about the history of the German language and the German culture. It comes with a CD where you can listen to German words that you learn throughout the different chapters. It is well structured. The book also seems resistant and I haven't had any sheets rip from the book. Overall I would definitely recommend this book to anyone that speaks English and is looking to a well structured guide to learn the German language by putting the time and effort.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: Learned a lot from this book! Within the first 19 chapters there's a sense feeling fluent and capable at German which I had taken in middle school and high school. Also read books by liveoutloud, a series of stories in German intended to teach as you read. Heidi's Frustuck, Die Barenhaus, (sorry no umlauts on my keyboard) and etc. They are on Amazon too, highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: I found the explanations easily understandable, the little fact blips are interesting and ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book as someone who had previously taken two semesters of beginning German Language in college and then had no active language learning for several years. I found this book to be an integral reference tool into picking back up where I left off in a very short amount of time. I found the explanations easily understandable, the little fact blips are interesting and the whole book is written to be an easy read, and there are many vocabulary words to learn. I found this book at the library and ended up purchasing it for myself.
customer_reviews.author: PandemoandMaia

customer_reviews.title: Many spelling mistakes for German words!
customer_reviews.text: The Kindle edition works as good supplementary material, but definitely cannot stand alone as the only source for Learning German. I appreciate the audio, but the book lacks vocabulary and has very limited exercises. Unfortunately the book is riddled with errors; many words in German are misspelled and translations are missing. I'm glad I study from multiple sources or I may not have noticed the errors and begun to make those same mistakes as well. If you use this e-book, please double check all conjugations before accepting them as the correct form!!
customer_reviews.author: Marisol M Poggi

customer_reviews.title: Great Book
customer_reviews.text: I am using Duolingo to learn German. I needed a bookto learn vocabulary. This book has done that. The book has a lot of good learning exercises and I find it very easy to understand.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn A. Martinie

customer_reviews.title: It’s a language book that you can hear!
customer_reviews.text: This review is specific to the Kindle version. Highly recommended. I’m just so excited to have a foreign language book that I can listen to! I’m only in the first few chapters, but I had to review already. There are icons to click after every sample of German text, and it helps so much. Being able to read the words and listen to them at the same time makes learning so much easier. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Hard to match CD tracks with book pages.
customer_reviews.text: Is mine the only one like this? "Track One" is followed by the announcement "Track 53" (which is on page 100) within the same track listing. I flip flip through the pages and in the meantime each word is only said once. Click on "Track 2" and after a quick run-through of words, it switches to "Track 77", or page 202. I haven't the patience to sort out how to use this. Not fun at all!
customer_reviews.author: Sue Ellen Sherblom

customer_reviews.title: Determined to learn German
customer_reviews.text: I'm thrilled to have this great book to help me begin my journey in learning German. I only wish that I had a disc player because I cannot listen to disc that probably holds a lot of great information that goes with the learning process. Although I think that this is a wonderful book for someone who has a disc player, I do wish there was a code for the internet where I could go and here the lesson that were meant for the disc but played online where I could hear and benefit from them.
customer_reviews.author: Donna A.86

customer_reviews.title: Passed A1 German Exam
customer_reviews.text: I used this book to begin my German language learning. I really liked that it taught in English and provided explanations for many things. This method allowed me not to feel nervous about learning a new language. It gives lots of tips to make learning easier when certain things are harder for English speakers. For example, learning articles with the nouns. And yes "Die, Der, Das" are the tough part of German. They also explain how other things are easier in German than in English. As I said, this makes learning more relaxed because I know that if I do the work little by little I will succeed.
customer_reviews.author: sandy

customer_reviews.title: Relies heavily on CD
customer_reviews.text: This book relies heavily on the included compact disc (CD) to supplement the teaching. That would normally be okay, but in our current days of technology advancement, certain people (myself included) have laptops that don't have CD readers. It would be helpful if they moved the CD over to an app platform, but I didn't see anything about that. I gave up after about 100 pages and I'm moving on to a different book.
customer_reviews.author: B. Polen

customer_reviews.title: Text Is Good
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty good, plenty of grammar, plurals, cases of verbs, gender. But they can't get away entirely from tables like what to expect in a German hotel or how to order a beer. I took off one star because the DVD is weak, e.g. on the DVD he accents the 2nd syllable of gymnasium whereas in te book they accent the first. Still don't know which is correct. This happens with about every third word.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Fallon

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste Your Time
customer_reviews.text: German with Jenny (YouTube) is a far better way to learn German.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: and a fun way to learn a language
customer_reviews.text: I've learned a ton from this book, and I'm a german native. It answered so many questions about the german grammar, which none of my teacher's were able to clarify very well. This book is really simple, and a fun way to learn a language. Even for someone like me.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: It goes all together
customer_reviews.text: I like it because it is practical, low price, and mostly, for pronunciation, it includes a CD which I consider invaluable in learning a foreign language. To the author: 1) textbooks for foreign language learning without audio are obsolescent 2) textbook like yours and the thew way 3) for the near future, audio CD in two speeds: slow and well pronounced then normal speed will be the ultimate. How about that?
customer_reviews.author: E. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Another good tool to learn German
customer_reviews.text: Another good tool to learn German.In the category of easily-portable-paper-bound books, it's a 4.5 for me.To learn a language you need to hear it & speak it. The single CD allows you to do this. You won't be ready to write thick books in German, but you will have a basic grasp of the language.
customer_reviews.author: Reasonable Guy

customer_reviews.title: Many errors in this book...
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying to learn German for years, mostly unsuccessfully. Even I noticed right away some problems with spelling mistakes. Help is listed as Helfe (with an L instead of an I.). It should be Hilfe. There are no sounds or videos in the kindle version (that I've seen yet). There are many Contradictions...On one page it will say how to pronounce a word or letter, and it will say something else on the next page...
customer_reviews.author: Super King

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Book!
customer_reviews.text: This book has saved my life. I am taking German in college with a poorly designed and executed curriculum. I am super pleased with the way this book explains the grammar which can be difficult. I recommend this book to anyone who is a beginner, or who wants to brush up on their German.
customer_reviews.author: jdephilly

customer_reviews.title: CD should be replaced with an online resource!
customer_reviews.text: Would prefer an online resource instead of a CD/DVD at the back of the book. CD/DVD drives are obsolete and book writers need to evolve. Since many important sounds and phrases are on the CD, the book is of limited use to me.
customer_reviews.author: Siva V.

customer_reviews.title: A good study aid.
customer_reviews.text: I like this little book. I have found it to be a great aid when "re-studying" the German I learned and spoke so many years ago. I would recommend it for new students of the language and for those who want to re-visit the German they learned some time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Karan S. Gier

customer_reviews.title: Well organized book
customer_reviews.text: I knew some german in school and forgot mot of it after 15 years of not using it. I wanted to take classes at Goethe Institute. But before taking the placement test that decides which level you start at, I wanted to do a quick review (for 3 days) so that I didnt get placed in a class much lower than my real ability. Used this book to review my German. The book was very well organized, easy to follow and helped me to revise most things that I had previously learned. That being said, I think its a great book for beginners too. It is particularly useful to revise your grammar.
customer_reviews.author: Lovestotravel

customer_reviews.title: The Everything Learning German Book
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my nephew. He was very happy to get the book and is working on learning the language. He hasn't given me any update on whether the book is easy or hard to get started though. He said he definitely needed the CD to hear the words.
customer_reviews.author: washington reviewer

customer_reviews.title: It's been fantastic! My two students are learning a LOT via ...
customer_reviews.text: Teaching German in my home school this year and this book has been the basis for our lessons. It's been fantastic! My two students are learning a LOT via this book. EXCELLENT resource!
customer_reviews.author: Saint Depraved

customer_reviews.title: Learning German Words Made easier.
customer_reviews.text: The book is excellent in that it displays German words that are easy to recognize and/or pronounce. However, the DVD tracks that I downloaded have to be changed; for example, after track 1 has played, it skips to track 3 or 21. I will try to order the tracks numerical if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Elizabeth Henderson

customer_reviews.title: I find it very useful, because it has lots of vocabulary not in ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought that this book might be too elementary for me becaue I have been self-studying German for the last several years. However, I find it very useful, because it has lots of vocabulary not in my other German language study texts, and many tips which I guess I missed in my studies to date.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Robert A. Eder

customer_reviews.title: Best Book for English Speakers Starting to Learn German
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best "learn German" book I've come across in the past ten years. Everything is clearly explained and concepts are introduced in a logical order. The book includes lots of cultural background and linguistic information, exercises with answers in the back, both Ger-Eng and Eng-Ger dictionaries, and an index of topics. Pair this with a good graded beginner's reader or set of simple German short stories for a great self-study course.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Great self study book, explains patterns and rules for vocabulary
customer_reviews.text: This book is great for self study, explains patterns and rules to make it easier to acquire a working vocabulary. I already knew some German when I got the book but liked it so much I bought a second copy for my son to use so that we could work together.
customer_reviews.author: Glen S. Wiley

customer_reviews.title: Great for starting to learn German
customer_reviews.text: This really helps fill in the gaps. I mainly use Rosetta Stone, but sometimes it’s not clear what the grammar is. This book really helps.
customer_reviews.author: Run LaLa Run

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This book moves at a great level for all levels of learners, I feel like I've gotten further in this book than I have in class. User friendly for sure! I've noticed there are a few annunciation that I've learned differently but this is most likely due to how many different variations of German there are.
customer_reviews.author: saradarling

customer_reviews.title: Blah
customer_reviews.text: This book is supposed to teach you German but the CD goes WAY to fast...basically rushes thru each word once and that's it. I had to replay the first lesson 10 times just to get the 1st 3 words. Not a good book for a beginner but if I already knew German it would have been a nice book.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Kindle version full of minor errors
customer_reviews.text: I have the Kindle version of this book, and it is full of minor errors which seem to have been due to the transfer process from print to ebook. For example, tables show the wrong columns, and references to tables in the body text are missing. These errors are not a problem for the alert reader, but they are nevertheless a distracting nuisance when one is trying to study.
customer_reviews.author: D. L. Yonge-Mallo

customer_reviews.title: Only recommend 100%
customer_reviews.text: German is a very hard language but I definitely love this book and it comes with a CD so you could follow along with the
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect but perfect enough
customer_reviews.text: I like this it's great for when my textbook cannot explain things properly enough! There are a few sections that I would like to be better explained (time) but overall this will stay in my library. This book exceeded my expectations and I have used it for about 3 months as of (3/26).
customer_reviews.author: mitchell

customer_reviews.title: It's O. K. but has too much phonetic ...
customer_reviews.text: It's O.K. but has too much phonetic pronunciation included so the students does not learn German pronunciation and has too much English description, some of which could be in German. Also, there are no pictures. Karina NYC
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wunderbar Buch!
customer_reviews.text: This really is EVERYTHING about learning German. The first few chapters are all about the fundamentals of language, comparisons of German to English, etc. I wish it had more writing activities, but it says in the beginning that the best way to learn any language is to speak it, so it advises to say all the words outloud.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great for learning and as a supplement to other programs.
customer_reviews.text: I am using this to supplement Rosetta Stone German and I really like it, but I have only been utilizing the book for a few weeks. We will see how it goes over the coming year. This provides some of the "why" for grammar and application that Rosetta is not designed to teach. It is not necessary to have the answers to speak German using Rosetta; however, I think that understanding the patterns in a language that come from the language rules can be useful when learning the language.
customer_reviews.author: God Bless America

customer_reviews.title: Good basic Germany starter book.
customer_reviews.text: Helping me while I'm living her in Germany. Basic but useful for the day to day basics and as a supplement to my class that I've started.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An excellent resource
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best Gertman textbooks/reference books out there. It contains a lot of well-structured, useful material. Also, the functional approach toward instruction, so aptly employed in this book, has always been and still is one of the most efficient tools in second/foreign language teaching. What is especially important, here, language and culture go hand in glove, which is critical to foreign language acquisition. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: Got this for an adult ed course. It came as expected and seems to be a great review book.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great! But it lacks exercises
customer_reviews.text: I happily learn German online and books from my university (I don't have enough money this year for classes) but I wanted a book with exercises , and this one lacks a lot, just 10 for each lesson, meanwhile my French book from 3 years ago contained like 50 for each lesson
customer_reviews.author: Migdalia Borrero

customer_reviews.title: Good Book
customer_reviews.text: This book has a lot of great vocabulary lists and includes little tips for getting on in Germany should you visit. It comes with a CD and it has exercises for every topic with answers in the back of the book to check yourself. In some ways I don't like the way it is structured but that could be personal preference. If used together with "German Made Simple: Learn to Speak and Understand German Quickly and Easily" you're on your way to getting a good solid base in the German language.
customer_reviews.author: VirginiaGirl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent supplement
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book to have if you are using Rosette Stone or other German language programs. It will explain a lot of the grammatical situations that seem to just happen and gives a simpler overview than a structured text book. I read it once through and now use it as reference when learning new material.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff B.

customer_reviews.title: Good book
customer_reviews.text: I bought it used, so it came with a few creases and writings but overall good. The book is easy to read. It starts with the basics of the german language and slowly introduces you to new words. If you want to learn German, this is the book for you.
customer_reviews.author: Renatilliusina

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Great for anyone wanting to learn some basics or even brush up on their German
customer_reviews.author: Beanybabe

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter and grandson and they love it.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Kilgen

customer_reviews.title: Not helpful in learning German
customer_reviews.text: Not helpful at all- I know some German so I wanted to brush up on it - this wasn't a good resource
customer_reviews.author: J. P.

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best Books for Autodidacts!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best self-study books I've come across! I took two semesters of German in college but that was several years ago and I wanted to re-learn the language. This book is excellent! It explains things cleary, it covers everything - not only grammar, but day-to-day language (greetings, shopping, etc.). It also has useful exercises that round out the learning and solidify in one's head. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Handyside

customer_reviews.title: This book goes beyond the language instruction
customer_reviews.text: This book not only teaches the language, but also explains some key factors about the German culture, which helps who is getting ready to live in Germany for some years. The book also highlights important tips about sentence construction and answer questions that would arise while learning the lesson. It is a great purchase to study German on one's own.
customer_reviews.author: Bebezitos

customer_reviews.title: Great Book
customer_reviews.text: Love this book. I find myself picking this up everyday to answer a question that comes up inmy daily German lessons.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great, but too few practice questions.
customer_reviews.text: Good to learn the basics. The audio track isn't too helpful, but its effective if coupled with other, more speech based products. I used it with German Podcasts and Rosetta stone Level one. Within 4 days of intensive study I was amazed by my progress in both speech and writing abilities. The only thing this book lacks is an effective way to enhance aural comprehension (listening skills) which I find to be the single most important skill in language learning.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Hyer

customer_reviews.title: Easy read
customer_reviews.text: I have been in German for about a year and I have learned to speak enough to hold a small conversation, but I still found myself confused grammatically. I bought this book for clarity and I found it.its easy to read and gives great examples to avoid the slightest confusion. I really like this book and would recommend, with a tutor or a class. I wouldn't try it with no previous knowledge.
customer_reviews.author: Riley

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: Love this book like taking a lesson in a class
customer_reviews.author: Alexandrea Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Interactive Features in a Kindle Book. Who Knew?
customer_reviews.text: Great reference tool for us beginning-German learners. Has audio features to help with pronunciation. I didn’t know Kindle could do that. I use it as a companion to my Rosetta Stone app.
customer_reviews.author: Kent Knudsen

customer_reviews.title: Great Book
customer_reviews.text: This book is a complete guide that talks about all german language skills in details and comes with the book a CD so You can practice listening and you can practice you pronouncation Highly recommend book for German Learners
customer_reviews.author: A.belhaj

customer_reviews.title: No audio in Kindle Edition with Audio/Video
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Kindle Edition with Audio/Video (Enhanced Edition) only to find no audio in it... also the format of the Kindle Edition is awful. So basically, don't buy the Kindle Edition although it's just 4 dollars...
customer_reviews.author: Jam

customer_reviews.title: Freshen up or in hurry to learn this is for you
customer_reviews.text: It is just what the description says. It is very detailed and easy to use. I bought it for my niece and she was reading it over the weekend and already can say 2 phrases. The audio CD helps a lot with pronouncing words.
customer_reviews.author: susisun

customer_reviews.title: The Everything Learning German Book
customer_reviews.text: A helpful tool to learn about Germany and its language. Great quick reference.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Anderson

customer_reviews.title: bought as a gift for my 14 year old grandson ...
customer_reviews.text: bought as a gift for my 14 year old grandson who is taking 1st year German in the 9th grade this year. His teacher told him to "study it and use it as a help. It will help you"
customer_reviews.author: Robert H Cudd Jr

customer_reviews.title: A great source of information.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a basic learner of German, and I have find in this book a great source of information. Well structured, simple and very straightforward, in my opinion, this is a must if you are studying to learn this language.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Vidal

customer_reviews.title: Its Okay
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Its pretty good if you're already used to learning langauges by yourself but if you're starting from scratch it could be difficult

customer_reviews.title: but the kindle version didn't have it--or I could not easily find the audio
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to listen to vocabulary, but the kindle version didn't have it--or I could not easily find the audio.
customer_reviews.author: Apollo

customer_reviews.title: I love the way that this book is organized
customer_reviews.text: I love the way that this book is organized!! I have been trying to learn German on my own because I want to be able to go at my own pace. But in doing that I became very disorganized and felt lost. This book has made things a lot easier for me. I have been looking for a good German language book and this one has a lot of great material without making the reader feel overwhelmed.
customer_reviews.author: CiChaWi

customer_reviews.text: I bought this book a few weeks ago and it is really helpful. I want to learn how to speak German for myself. It is a helpful book with a CD to assist with pronouncing words/verbs/phrases correctly. I would advise folks that are wanting to learn some basic German - purchase the book.

customer_reviews.title: Kindle layout is not good
customer_reviews.text: I got the kindle version and the layout is not reader friendly

customer_reviews.title: decent beginner material
customer_reviews.text: its a good book for beginners. i am using this along side a phone app which i use. the book is a good reference and decent study material when your phone is not available. i haven't yet used the included cd but overall i think its worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Darkknightt

customer_reviews.title: Not A Quick Reference  Book
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping for a quick reference book to supplement language app. Too detailed for what I needed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I thought it would be a good companion book to "German for Dummies" which I also ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second book I purchased for my grandson. I thought it would be a good companion book to "German for Dummies" which I also purchased. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Bettye M. Lippincott

customer_reviews.title: Errors and discrepancies
customer_reviews.text: I did not get far before I began to notice many discrepancies between the written pronunciation keys and the pronunciation on the audio CD. Most of the differences are syllable stress, but I also noticed a few vowel and consonant errors. It looks like a good teaching approach for adult English speakers, so it's a shame the editing and basic proofreading is so poor. Example: Vater is given as FAH-tuh on one page, VAH-tuh on the written word list on the following page, and FAH-tuh (or more like FAH-tuhr) on the audio CD. I don't want to guess all the way through which pronunciation is correct, so I'm returning this.
customer_reviews.author: K. M. Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Vielen Dank! Das ist gut!
customer_reviews.text: A great supplement to Rosetta Stone. I will one day speak German fluently. Ja.
customer_reviews.author: Lavender

customer_reviews.title: The Everything Learning German Book:
customer_reviews.text: love this book priced well came quick and love it, thanks
customer_reviews.author: NormaRae

customer_reviews.title: Not a good book if you want to learn BASIC German.
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a good book but not if you are wanting to learn German. NOT a beginner's book. I will keep it in the hope I can get good enough to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Robi Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Learning German Book and CD
customer_reviews.text: This is a gift for a friend that is part German and would like to learn the basics of English to German translation. It comes with a CD also and looks like a nice gift for the novice learning German.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Savaikis

customer_reviews.title: Handy book to refresh the language
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my husband for an upcoming trip to Germany in August. He has been using this book daily to brush-up his German and he likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Hollydog

customer_reviews.title: Very informative
customer_reviews.text: I struggle with grammer. This book is really helpful in explaining the rules in conjunction with the language apps I use.
customer_reviews.author: Felisha Daye

customer_reviews.title: My teen student has enjoyed this supplement to her already school studies
customer_reviews.text: My teen student has enjoyed this supplement to her already school studies. We found quite a few alternative exercises. Grateful for the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Mazrum

customer_reviews.title: Greatly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Easy learning. Nice with CD enforcement of the Germany language in hearing it spoken. Greatly recommend.

customer_reviews.text: I really like it, but it should just be used a s to get your basic german learning.

customer_reviews.text: A lovely book and essential for getting yourself started learning German. Great exercises, explanations, and vocabulary.

customer_reviews.text: Very helpful book... however there is a lesson missing in the CD. Chapter/ Lesson 11 was missing....
customer_reviews.author: Edith

customer_reviews.title: useful in conjunction with other materials
customer_reviews.text: I found this book easy to follow and learn from until about chaper 15, about three quarters of the way through. It started to go too fast when it got to perfect tenses and I had to go to other resources to get a better grounding to move forward. Finally i decided to just move past the perfect tenses to the other material just to finish the book.
customer_reviews.author: pjf

customer_reviews.title: A great grammar book that covers from the basics to the ...
customer_reviews.text: A great grammar book that covers from the basics to the complex language nuances in a very structured way, and with an excellent pace that you can adapt to your learning. If you are a self-learner this is a must-have.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Moreno

customer_reviews.title: A great introduction
customer_reviews.text: Swick's approach is conducive to those with no familiarity with the German language (or those looking to brush up on their grammar). His attention to direct and indirect objects helps the reader make sense of German's numerous (definite and indefinite) articles. Swick introduces the material in a logical, sequential fashion (i.e. He discusses telling time before introducing the past and future tenses). The book notes differences in colloquial and written German to help the reader understand how natives use the language. The exercises are short but provide good practice. It's a good book!
customer_reviews.author: J. Knigge

customer_reviews.title: It is a good book. We have used it in our German ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a good book. We have used it in our German class (continuing education for adults) and it has been good. The CD could have been better (be good to listen in the car if it didn't require you to be looking at the book so that part would have been better - not requiring to have the book in front of you).
customer_reviews.author: J. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Great Resource
customer_reviews.text: This book is grea for the very beginners as well as a clear resource for intermediate or advanced learners. The "lessons" are easy to understand and full of information and tips. The cultural tips which the book also gives is VERY helpful. I went to Germany after having read this book and felt so much more prepared than I did before I read the book.
customer_reviews.author: PvK

customer_reviews.title: This text is pretty much the same as the first one
customer_reviews.text: This text is pretty much the same as the first one. Again, good book for rules, but not for a textbook. This retired Spanish and English as a Second Language teacher can't recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice book! Learn German fast!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect condition book, easy to read, great way to learn German
customer_reviews.author: BlackLabsRule

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: very easy book to use , helped me a lot
customer_reviews.author: Loring Kohrt

customer_reviews.title: Pronunciations are difficult to comprehend with this book.
customer_reviews.text: I have been studying German very lightly using various online sources, and those sources seem to be at odds with the approximate pronunciations given in this book. Frankly, the words used for comparisons of vowel sounds are way off mark and are very confusing. The audio CD plays entirely too fast on the first couple of tracks. There is little (IMO) enunciation of the syllables, the words are spoken at native German speed, as far as I can tell. All in all, I am happy with this book, and I'm glad I purchased it, but I will continue to supplement my learning with online sources.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Gugino

customer_reviews.title: Time to make audio downloadable
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy, straightforward book for beginners. My only irritation is that the audio is available only on a CD. Since it's 2015, it would be nice to make that content downloadable so one could listen to it as a podcast.
customer_reviews.author: P. Mimula

customer_reviews.title: but I liked the fact that it contains an overview of German ...
customer_reviews.text: It was too basic for me, but I liked the fact that it contains an overview of German all in one place. For a beginner, it would be great, as it highlights the similarities between English and German and makes the language more approachable. I have two other books by Ed Swick, German Grammar Drill and German Pronouns and Prepositions and think that all of his books are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Bed-Stuy reader

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book for learning or refreshing. The enclosed CD is great!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend it to anyone looking for something to aid in ...
customer_reviews.text: I suppose I didn't really need this book anymore by the time I actually got around to buying it, but it has helped immensely in re-establishing my basic German during the various times that I've not been able to study. I would recommend it to anyone looking for something to aid in that regard, though not for further instruction. That should not be sought after through a book of this nature anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Sante Howard

customer_reviews.title: A Solid And Infomative Book
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best books I've used for learning German. The CD that comes with the book is pretty useless so I supplement this book with a couple others that include CDs. Overall a very good book for building a foundation
customer_reviews.author: Derek Rochniak

customer_reviews.title: REVIEW FOR THE EVERYTHING LEARNING GERMAN BOOK
customer_reviews.text: It is a wonderful book -- makes a good reference book too and I enjoy the extra information about the country as well. I am enjoying learning German and find this book along with the pronunciation disk a great help.
customer_reviews.author: frances wylie

customer_reviews.title: Great place to start
customer_reviews.text: I'm coming back to German language learning after a long hiatus - about thirty years since High School German. This book is a great place to start; it provides interesting history of the German language, discussion of various parts of speech, and always ties it back to analogous words and phrases in English. There may be more advanced texts available, but this is an excellent starting point.
customer_reviews.author: David Vaughan

customer_reviews.title: Not for kids
customer_reviews.text: This is a book for serious adults to learn German. It did not at all work for my 10 year old granddaughter.
customer_reviews.author: Gisela

customer_reviews.title: Easy German Book
customer_reviews.text: I living in Germany and i Start TO Take German Basic class, it was very Hard for Fellow the Class with the German Instructor and a German Text book. I notice that After purchase this book I learn more in One week that what i had ben lernend in the Last two months. Easy TO Fellow.
customer_reviews.author: Gonzo1

customer_reviews.title: every thing learning German  book
customer_reviews.text: A very good book for a beginner or intermediate for revision. Combined with other methods of learning it is one of the best books on the subject that I have used so far. Explanation is excellent and very well presented in a manner that is easy to remember.The CD that comes with it is invaluable. Well worth a buy.
customer_reviews.author: bob

product_meta.title: The Everything Learning German Book: Speak, write, and understand basic German in no time
